author: Jim Chairusmi
title: Women’s Hockey Win Caps a Strong Medal Surge for Team USA
text:
GANGNEUNG, South Korea—When the U.S. women’s hockey team stunned Canada in a shootout Thursday, it not only gave the team its first gold in the sport since 1998. It also crowned a 24-hour, badly needed American run of eight medals at these Winter Olympics.
Jocelyne Lamoureux-Davidson scored on a sixth-round shootout attempt and U.S. goalie Maddie Rooney stopped Canada’s final shot to spark pandemonium on the ice and living-room celebrations in the U.S., where the game ended well past midnight in most time zones.
...
